rulings.text: If an attacking creature has multiple evasion abilities, such as shadow and flying, a creature can block it only if that creature satisfies all of the appropriate evasion abilities.

rulings.text: An ability that triggers when something "attacks and isn't blocked" triggers in the declare blockers step after blockers are declared if (1) that creature is attacking and (2) no creatures are declared to block it. It will trigger even if that creature was put onto the battlefield attacking rather than having been declared as an attacker in the declare attackers step.
If an attacking creature has multiple evasion abilities, such as shadow and flying, a creature can block it only if that creature satisfies all of the appropriate evasion abilities.
Multiple instances of shadow on the same creature are redundant.
Once a creature has been blocked, that creature remains blocked and will deal and be dealt combat damage even if it gains or loses shadow or if the blocking creature gains or loses shadow.

rulings.text: The ability is controlled by the player who controls Bottomless Pit. This means that Bottomless Pit can trigger abilities which trigger off an opponent forcing you to discard.

foreignData.name: Lebendige Brücke
foreignData.text: Jede Kreatur, deren Stärke größer als die Anzahl Karten auf Deiner Hand ist, kann nicht angreifen.

mainBoard.name: Ensnaring Bridge
mainBoard.originalText: Each creature with power greater than the number of cards in your hand cannot attack.

rulings.text: Ensnaring Bridge's effect checks the number of cards in your hand only while a player (including you) is declaring attackers. Once a creature has legally attacked, changing its power or the number of cards in your hand won't remove it from combat.

mainBoard.text: Creatures with power greater than the number of cards in your hand can't attack.

mainBoard.name: Hornet Cannon
mainBoard.originalText: {3}, ocT: Put a Hornet token into play. Treat this token as a 1/1 artifact creature with flying that is unaffected by summoning sickness. At end of turn, destroy the token.
mainBoard.text: {3}, {T}: Create a 1/1 colorless Insect artifact creature token with flying and haste named Hornet. Destroy it at the beginning of the next end step.

foreignData.name: Fallgitter
foreignData.text: Immer wenn eine Kreatur ins Spiel kommt und zwei oder mehr andere Kreaturen im Spiel sind, lege diese Kreatur zur Seite. Wenn das Fallgitter das Spiel verlässt, bringe die Kreatur unter der Kontrolle ihres Besitzers ins Spiel.

mainBoard.name: Portcullis
mainBoard.originalText: Whenever any creature comes into play, if there are two or more other creatures in play, set that creature aside. If Portcullis leaves play, put the creature into play under its owner's control.

rulings.text: Creatures which are phasing in will not trigger this card's ability.
If the creature that triggered Portcullis is no longer on the battlefield when the ability resolves, then it fails to do anything.
You check the count of the number of creatures on the battlefield again during resolution. The creature will not be exiled if the count is 2 or less.

The "when Portcullis leaves the battlefield" ability is set up as part of the ability that exiles the creature. It will trigger when Portcullis leaves the battlefield even if Portcullis has somehow lost its abilities at that time.

The creature does enter, so any other abilities that trigger on it entering trigger. This follows the normal rules for timing triggered abilities: first, the current player puts their abilities on the stack in any order, then each other player in turn order does the same. Portcullis' own ability is included in this, so it could result in the creature being exiled after some abilities have resolved, but before others.

mainBoard.text: Whenever a creature enters, if there are two or more other creatures on the battlefield, exile that creature. Return that card to the battlefield under its owner's control when this artifact leaves the battlefield.
